data.title: Cannot collapse "Regions" or "Here Strings" in VC Code when working with the Microsoft PowerShell extension
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.9.0-insider (215a0af33046d3940e665d46ecaeac9623f2f769, 2017-01-19T07:12:16.209Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.8.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

Hello 
With PowerShell code you can use #region and  #endregion which latter allows you to easily to collapse and expand sections of code.

Also Here Strings e.g.

@"
I am a here string
blah
blah
"@
are not seen as collapsible elements either

Can you please add the above functionality to make it far easier to work with PowerShell (and probably other extensions) in VS Code

Thanks in advance
ErnestBrant@outlook.com

data.title: Classes for styling - incompatible changes.
Prevent opening new editor group when using focusNextGroup
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: Version 1.8.1 (1.8.1)
- OS Version: MacOS 10.12.2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have less than three editor groups open with your cursor in the rightmost editor group
2. Activate command focusNextGroup
3. A new editor group will open to the right of your current editor group and the cursor will jump over there

It would be nice to be able to prevent this unwanted opening of an additional editor group which already has shortcuts like cmd+2 or cmd+3 if you really need one more. With the current behavior I end up opening and having to close the rightmost editor group multiple times in a day.

data.title: Unjustified "git push"
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
![2017-01-19_16h33_40](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3082812/22108613/0bba1562-de65-11e6-88ea-8b76605e3d78.png)

- OS Version: win7-pro

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open the project not containing not pushed changes
2. Press to "Synchronize changes"
3. Open git OUTPUT. See that run the command "git push", but the local branch has no changes, not submitted to any remote branch. Instead of "git push" should check for unsent changes only after which you can call "git push".
![2017-01-19_16h29_21](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3082812/22108706/7aec68ae-de65-11e6-8e31-e5560b15d2fa.png)

PS:
I think that should prompt for confirmation to send changes to a remote branch, as was done in previous versions of VSCode

data.title: Debugger not showing value of variables
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.9.0-insider (215a0af33046d3940e665d46ecaeac9623f2f769, 2017-01-19T07:12:16.209Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.8.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

Hello,
I am new to VS Code and want to use it to write/debug PowerShell scripts.  I normally use PowerGUI IDE for PowerShell, but want to move over to VS Code.

A simple but very useful feature in PowerGUI is the ability to see the value and type of any variables once they have been populated. Therefore if you write and execute some simple code like the following

$A = 10
$B = 1,2,3,4

once executed you can hover over the variable in question with your mouse and it will tell you the TYPE and current value/s of the variable.

I do not see this in VS Code and when using the debugger the variables pane (top left) is blank e.g. it also does not list any variables or their values.

It this because the PowerShell extension simply does not support this? 

Being able to see the current value (if any) of any variables in your script (once executed once) is a must have I would say otherwise it makes it very difficult indeed to debug a script.

Also if I set a break-point and start the debugger, the only option I get is to 'stop' the debugger and when I do I receive the following error: Debug adapter process has terminated unexpectedly
again I do not see the value of any variables.

Please advise
Thanks in advance
ErnestBrant@outlook.com

data.title: SignatureHelpProvider gets confused with similar parameter labels
data.body:
SignatureHelpProvider seems to get confused with similar parameter labels and results in a weird render of the parameters:
![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Janne252/vscode-test-signatureHelpProvider/master/images/issue_before.png)
It should look like this:
![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Janne252/vscode-test-signatureHelpProvider/master/images/issue_after.png)

- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro, 1607

Steps to Reproduce:

The "issue" can be reproduced with this test extension: [Janne252/vscode-test-signatureHelpProvide](https://github.com/Janne252/vscode-test-signatureHelpProvider) (see the readme for additional steps)

data.title: Strange behaviours of formatting for double spans
data.body:
OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.2 VScode Version: ![screen shot 2017-01-19 at 12 04 28](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/774409/22104512/c59bacb4-de3f-11e6-8318-408d1c39fc12.png) The shortcut `shift+alt+f` is used to format the whole document (without having to select anything), and `cmd+k cmd+f` is used to format the selection. ``` { "key": "shift+alt+f", "command": "editor.action.formatDocument", "when": "editorHasDocumentFormattingProvider && editorTextFocus && !editorReadonly" }, { "key": "cmd+k cmd+f", "command": "editor.action.formatSelection", "when": "editorHasDocumentFormattingProvider && editorHasSelection && editorTextFocus && !editorReadonly" }, ``` My experiments show that formatting html does not work well for the following case: ``` try
posted by
 ``` will be formatted to ``` try
posted by
 ``` Does anyone know what's happening? Cheers

data.title: VSCode Typescript Intellisense slows to crawl after 5-10 minutes
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Insiders Version 1.9.0-insider (1.9.0-insider) 39d761bf1f4ce7ea605539bdba41a8727b3c7ce0
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.2 (16C67) (2013 rMBP, i7, 16GB RAM, 1TB SSD)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open large Angular (2.4.3) project and after a while (5-10 minutes) intellisense slows down to a crawl taking 5-15 seconds to generate. If you force it (ctrl + space?), it'll sit for a while with "Loading..."

Disabled most addons, only have:

* Angular VS Code TypeScript and HTML Snippets
* Angular Language Service (installed after this started happening)
* Auto-Open Markdown Preview
* Bootstrap 3 Snippets

Enabled.

I disabled other addons such as C#/Ionide-fsharp/etc.

data.title: Debugger gets stuck when starting debug adapter on non-existing runtime executable
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.x (Insiders)
- OS Version: macOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open node-debug project and
2. edit package.json and break the `runtime` attribute, e.g. by adding an 'x' in `"runtime": "nodex"`.
3. lauch debug session "extension"
4. in the new window start debugging a node program 

Observe: 
This expected error message appears:
![2017-01-19_10-27-20](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/22101026/e2393ac0-de31-11e6-9b7e-1d317d4c790d.png)
After dismissing this, the debugger is still in a session where pressing the terminate button has no effect.

data.title: Two error notifications when starting debug adapter on non-existing program
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.x (Insiders)
- OS Version: macOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open node-debug project and
2. edit package.json and break the path in the `program` attribute, e.g. by adding an 'x' in `"program": "./out/node/nodeDebugx.js"`.
3. lauch debug session "extension"
4. in the new window start debugging a node program 

Observe: 
the following (expected) error message appears:
![2017-01-19_10-16-52](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/22100588/7b961bcc-de30-11e6-8a36-bdc0dc5c61da.png)
After one second this error notification appears again time.

data.title: Add Toggle Output Scroll Lock action
data.body:
As discussed here https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/18589#issuecomment-273528192.
@isidorn I have implemented the action and added it to the panel, but it's missing the icon. I'm also not sure how to make the action button reflect if the output is locked or not. Perhaps it's possible to use the action `checked` property and style the checked button in the same CSS file where the icon will be referenced, but the issue is that the action is not channel specific (ie there's only one instance of the action per panel, not per channel).

data.title: Walk-through: Avoid creating temporary files
data.body: The third change introduces another custom URI scheme for embedded code snippets. The main problem is that the TypeScript extension only supports the file:// scheme. (Another problem is that the markdown needs to be parsed multiple times.)

data.title: Investigate to show combined confirm dialog for all close actions
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0 Insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Turn off Auto Save
2. Touch multiple files
3. From the editor group More (...) button, click Close All or View: Close All Editors in Group command

A dialog is still shown for each dirty file unlike Command Palette View: Close All Editors command

data.title: Prototyping Markdown Preview Synchronization With Editors
data.body:
Builds on #18422 to implement basic synchronization between markdown editor and its preview. Adds the following:

* When opening the md preview for the first time, automatically scrolls to view the current selected line from the markdown editor.
* When changing the selection in the markdown editor, updates the markdown preview scroll to reveal this element.
* When double clicking an element on the markdown preview page, opens an editor and reveals this line.
* Indicator in preview to show currently selected line

Functionality can be disabled using `markdown.preview.experimentalSyncronizationEnabled`

data.title: Maintain Markdown Preview Scroll Position on Window Resize
data.body:
**Bug**
Currently, when resizing an editor with a markdown preview, the preview shifts all around.

![jan-18-2017 14-46-26](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/22086291/f399bbbe-dd8c-11e6-84e7-55c5b2b2366a.gif)

**Fix**
Add some custom js to handle this better. The js maintains the relative offset when resizing the window.

![jan-18-2017 14-49-52](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/22086396/655963bc-dd8d-11e6-80fb-73016d59ea18.gif)

This simple solution isn't perfect because page reflows can cause the elements to shift around relative on the page. I find it better than the current behavior though, and will investigate further improvements with the scrolling sync work.

data.title: Fixed named headers for markdown preview
data.body:
**Bug**
Named headers are not being generated in the markdown preview. Root cause seems to be my changed that added line number data to some elements.

**Fix**
In the custom line number render, make sure we play nice with other markdown-it extensions.

FYI @gregvanl

data.title: Hard crash (of everything) when debugging nodejs
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.8.1 (1.8.1) - ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281 - 2016-12-19T14:40:36.266Z
- OS Version: macos 10.12.2
- Nodejs version: v6.7.0

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open code in empty folder
2. create an app.js with 2 console.writeline() functions
3. set breakpoints
4. go to debug pane, accept default setup
5. press f5 or debug button
6. when breakpoint is hit, press the stop button

On my colleges machine, vscode crashes. On my machine *everything* crashes (the shell, all applications, everything...) then the shell restarts.

repo gif attached... you don't see the crash because the app recording the gif gets killed...
![crashanim](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3179452/22083145/65f62ffa-dd90-11e6-99cd-0193b4304e42.gif)

Anyone else???
